overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to forecasting with limited time-series data (96 hourly points). It identifies daily seasonality as the dominant pattern, considers advanced models like SARIMA but opts for simple averaging due to data constraints. The solution prioritizes robustness over complexity, emphasizing data completeness checks and pattern-based heuristics.
key_insights: Daily seasonality is the primary pattern leveraged in forecasting
Limited data (4 days) constrains model selection to simple heuristics
Hourly averaging effectively handles seasonality without complex modeling
Data completeness verification precedes model application
Day-type mismatches (e.g., forecasting weekdays from weekend data) require pattern generalization
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines statistical awareness (seasonality detection, model considerations) with practical simplification. Balances advanced model knowledge with heuristic implementation due to data limitations.
